title: 108_hr4915
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gains from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gains from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, property, or as compensation for services. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gains from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The stock must be in a qualified small business C corporation, acquired for money, property, or as compensation for services, and publicly traded on specific exchanges. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gains from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers in qualified small businesses with a market capitalization not exceeding $150,000,000. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gains from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers in qualified small businesses if the market capitalization is not more than $150,000,000. Market capitalization is determined based on the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares. The reporting period for determining gains from the sale of section 1203 stock is based on the most recent annual or quarterly report filed with the SEC under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The reporting period for gains from the sale of section 1203 stock is based on the most recent annual or quarterly report filed with the SEC under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Additional rules apply, including aggregation rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) and rules from subsections (f), (g), (h), (i), (j), and (k) of section 1202 with a substitution of '1 year' for '5 years' in subsection (j)(1)(A). Additional rules apply to gains from the sale of section 1203 stock, with rules similar to section 1202 and a substitution of '1 year' for '5 years' in subsection (j)(1)(A). Conforming amendments are made to sections 642(c)(4) and 643(a)(3) of the Code. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including inserting references to section 1203, in addition to section 1202. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including inserting references to section 1203 along with section 1202. Section 1202 is amended by adding a new subsection related to section 1203 stock. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for part 1 of subchapter P of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by section 1203 provide an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies. This applies to securities acquired after the enactment of the Act.
